Intervention: Low-level laser therapy: Placebo LLL combined with CDT
Low-level Laser: Active LLL combined with CDT
Eligibility: Incorporation criteria:
- Unilateral breast cancer with ipsilateral lumpectomy or mastectomy and lymph node dissection (sensinel biopsy or axillary dissection)
Phase II or III unilateral secondary lymphedema of the upper extremity (as defined by the International Society of Lymphology)
Circumferential difference of 2 cm and/or volume of 200 mL compared to the upper end not involved in any 4 cm segment
In a position to commit to a long-term follow-up schedule
- Exclusion criteria:
Active cancer/metastatic cancer
Currently, receive or have plans for adjuvant radiation or chemotherapy
Pregnant women
Other lymphedema of the extremities (primary or secondary)
- Heart stimulator
• Artificial joints in the upper quadrants
Renal impairment
Insufficiency of arterial function
Congestive heart failure
Chronic inflammatory disorders
• History of deep venous thrombosis (DVT) in upper lymphedemic extremities
Previous low-level laser treatment (regardless of indication)
A known medicine(s) to affect body fluid balance
Body Mass Index (BMI) > 40 (mortbid obesity)
Results: Description of the arm/group: CDT + LLL inactive
Low-level laser therapy: Placebo LLL combined with CDT
Title of the arm/group: LL Combined with CDT
Description of the arm/group: CDT + active LLL
Low-level Laser: Active LLL combined with CDT
